channel.title: Irish Song and Recitation: History, Chat and Sing
channel.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
channel.itunes:summary: The home of song and story for the Irish around the world. You are invited to sing your favorite song, play your tune, or tell your story. Just leave it on my recorder at 816-454-2410. It can be 1,000 years old from Ireland or something you just put together. Come to the table and share yours at the Irish Roots Cafe. Our third podcast series, it follows 1) Irish Genealogy and family history and 2) Missouri Irish: History and Legend. And remember: Every Day is a Holiday at the Irish Roots Cafe !
channel.description: The home of song and story for the Irish around the world. You are invited to sing your favorite song, play your tune, or tell your story. Just leave it on my recorder at 816-454-2410. It can be 1,000 years old from Ireland or something you just put together. Come to the table and share yours at the Irish Roots Cafe. Our third podcast series, it follows 1) Irish Genealogy and family history and 2) Missouri Irish: History and Legend. And remember: Every Day is a Holiday at the Irish Roots Cafe !

item.title: The Mad Puck Goat (An Poc Ar Buile)
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary:
Gaelic Brass (Liza) www.Irishroots.com
With host Michael O'Laughlin
Artist Interview: Liza Group: Gaelic Brass Song: The Mad Puck Goat (An Poc Ar Buile)
This is a change of pace and burst of creativity for our Sean Nos podcast series. Liza has submitted this entry, which is a dramatic shift from the other songs in this series, so sit back and enjoy.
Here are the Lyrics in Irish: The Mad Puck Goat (An Poc Ar Buile) Ag gabhail dom sior chun Droichead Ui Mhoradha
Pice im dhoid's me ag dul i meithil Ce casfai orm i gcuma ceoidh [gach duine] Ach pocan cron is e ar buile...
[chorus]
Ailliliu, puilliliu, ailliliu ta an puc ar buile! Ailliliu, puilliliu, ailliliu ta an puc ar buile!
Do ritheamar trasna tri ruillogach, Is do ghluais an comhrac ar fud na muinge, Is treascairt do bhfuair se sna turtoga [g.d.] Chuas ina ainneoin ina dhrom le fuinneamh...
(chorus)
Nior fhag se carraig go raibh scot ann Na gur rith le forsa chun me a mhilleadh, S'Ansan sea do chaith se an leim ba mho. [g.d.] Le fana mhor na Faille Brice...
(chorus)
Bhi garda mor i mBaile an Roistigh Is bhailigh forsa chun sinn a chlipeadh Do bhuail se rop da adhairc sa toin ann [g.d.] S'da bhriste nua do dhein se giobail...
[chorus]
I nDaingean Ui Chuis le haghaidh an trathnona Bhi an sagart paroiste amach 'nar gcoinnibh Is e duirt gurbh e an diabhal ba Dhoigh leis [g.d.] A ghaibh an treo ar phocan buile...

The Irish Song and Recitation Podcast from the Irish Roots Cafe

Renata Henley is the host of Hello Fada, with curious news and notes on the Irish language, for beginners.

item.title: Sadhbh Ni Bhruinneallaigh - Mayo Boatmans love
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary:
Sean Nos, old style Irish Song www.Irishroots.com
Season 3 of the Irish Song and Recitation Festival
Sean Nos With your host Mick the Bridge (aka O'Laughlin)
We kick off this season with a brief introduction and a song about a Mayo Boatman who is enticing his love to elope with him. After all, his boat sails all the way to Galway, and her mother wants her to elope with him, and that's just for starters !
The host begins this season with the song himself.
Leave your message at 816-256-3360

item.title: Spailpin Fanach, Irish, English, American
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary:
16 - The Spailpin I Left Behind Me
www.IrishRoots.com 816-256-3360
From the Irish Roots Cafe Broadcast Network. Irish Song and Recitation Festival Announcing the 2nd Season. Episode 16.
Listen to the Chat and Sing episodes here: http://www.irishroots.com/podcast3/rss.xml
or on iTunes from our podcast providers page at: http://itunes.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewArtist?id=299857025 __________________________________________
Impromptu Song by your host today:
Today we hear three short versions of the old Irish tune known as The Spailpin Fanach, or the Wandering Laborer.
The First is in the Irish. The Second is translated into English. The Third is the song changed in America
This is a very rough cut, but will illustrate the journey any given song may have taken into modern times !
************************************* The second season of the Song and Recitation Festival.
We also reserve space for you to phone it in if you missed the festival in person. If you have an Irish tune or recitation that has a special meaning or memory for you, then phone it in. Drop me a line from our web page at www.Irishroots.com
We can all learn a bit from each other I think....

item.title: Una Bhan; MacDermott, Costello, Fair Una
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary: The Irish Romeo and Juliet brought to life The Irish Roots Cafe www.Irishroots.com From the Irish Roots Cafe Broadcast Network. Irish Song and Recitation Festival Advance Shownotes. episode 14 . ************************************* Chat and Sing Song of the Day: Una Bhan ************************************* Get All 3 of our Free Broadcasts: - Irish in America - Irish Families - Irish Song - ************************************* Our Newest Broadcast Series Timeline Todays Chat: 1:50 Todays Sing:14:57 ************************************* Mondays Chat Noted author Edward Kneafsey talks with us and sings "Una Bhan" as he recalls it from County Mayo, Ireland. Many of you will know Ed as the author of "Surnames of Ireland", the first book to map families in Ireland and publish the results in book form, which we did a few years back. ************************************* Phone my recorder at 816 256-3360 to leave your message, sing your song, or tell your story.... It's all for fun and it's all for free ! *************************************
item.itunes:keywords: Irish, Ireland, Traditional, Music, Song, History, Sean-Nos Theatre, America, Canada, Australia, England

item.title: A Nation Once Again; A Soldiers Song; Irish Anthems
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary:
The Irish Roots Cafe www.Irishroots.com Chat and Sing From the Irish Roots Cafe Broadcast Network. Irish Song and Recitation Festival Advance Shownotes. episode 13 . ************************************* Chat and Sing: Irish National Anthems; in Irish and English ************************************* The Newest Broadcast Series from www.Irishroots.com Timeline Todays Chat: 1:40 Todays Sing: A Nation Once Again: 11:00 in English The Soldiers Song: 19:45 in English and Irish ************************************* Mondays Chat Peter is with us again today for the grand finale. We ask for something in the Irish language perhaps. Peter notes the Irish language and how some of the native speakers will talk to only those they see fit. We also note how Peter won a song challenge in Ireland, only by ending the tune in the Irish language. We have noted and sung the following 'anthems' on past shows:
A Tipperary anthem - Slievenamon A Cork anthem- The Banks of My Own Lovely Lee N. Ireland Commonwealth: Londonderry Aire (Danny Boy)
************************************* Get All 3 of our Free Broadcasts at www.Irishroots.com - Irish in America - Irish Families - Irish Song - ************************************* Today we'll hear: 1) A Nation Once Again, which preceeded the Soldiers Song. 2) National Anthem of Ireland (Republic)- The Soldiers Song (1907) written by Peadar O'Kearney and Patrick Heany. Performed today by Peter Reilly Adams.
item.itunes:keywords: Irish, Ireland, Traditional, Music, Song, History, Sean-Nos Theatre, America, Canada, Australia, England

item.title: Where the River Shannon Flows: Protest
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary: Maids to Order www.Irishroots.com Chat and Sing The Irish Song and Recitation Festival Episode 10. Todays Surprising Selection: Where the River Shannon Flows Irish immigrants once protested this song, throwing rotten eggs at the composer on stage. Today, this song by James Russell is a classic Irish- American Tune. A great example of how to overcome prejudice. Read the full details on my blog and listen to the podcast at www.Irishroots.com
item.itunes:keywords: Irish, Ireland, Traditional, Music, Song, History, Sean-Nos Theatre, America, Canada, Australia, England

item.title: An Spailpin Fanach and Rattlesnake Fritters
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary: Connie Dover from Arkansas to Oxford ************************************************ Chat and Sing Episode 9. From the Irish Roots Cafe Broadcast Network ! ************************************************* Phone 816 256-3360 to leave your family search ask a question, sing your song, or tell your story.... We'll try to share it with our listeners.... It's all for fun and it's all for free ! ************************************************* Connie interprets An Spailpin Fanach in an impromptu solo performance for us ! You might recognize that this was the original tune from whence came The Girl I Left Behind Me. Despite its lively sound, the story is a sad one, as you will see when reading the lyrics on my blog at www.Irishroots.com. We listen to Connie rehearse few times as she recalls the language and the melody. Sort of like being in the back room before a performance. A brave and generous soul indeed she is ! I do take full responsibility for forcing her into this situation unprepared - and am amazed at her ability to perform under such an ambush. We also hear about how her life and career developed from childhood dreams, and life as a ranch cook in Wyoming. Connie had the folks here lined up almost out the door to try some her Moose and rattlesnake fritters platters last week.... ****************************** How to Contact Me Reach me anytime at Irishroots.com, or drop by the Irish Roots Cafe 24 hours a day. Send in your Irish stories and recitations.... The Irish Roots Cafe Box 7575 Kansas City, Missouri 64116 Until we meet again, I hope you'll be remembering the best of Your Irish Heritage...
item.itunes:keywords: Irish, Ireland, Traditional, Music, Song, History, Sean-Nos Theatre, America, Canada, Australia, England

item.title: Connie Dover Siuila Run Song (Walk My Love)
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary: www.Irishroots.com Winter Count Poetry Todays Chat and Sing: Breakfast at the Cafe today Antelope Stew and Rattlesnake Fritters from Wyoming prepared for us today by Connie Dover, a sometime 'Ranch Cook'. ( Yet always a tremendous singer, historian and poet.) I first heard Connie when she was singing with Scartaglen back in the 1980's. She often sings solo, and has studied Celtic music on both sides of the ocean. Born in Arkansas, she has 4 albums released and has made numerous guest appearances on other labels. Todays Song Connie chats a bit about her experience with Irish and Celtic music. She writes about 1/3 of her own music, and was awarded the title of grand master at the 2nd annual Song Festival here. I put her on the spot, with no advance notice. With a rare confidence she accepts the challenge to sing a tune in the Irish language that she has not sung in years. This is a rare talent indeed. She sings a bit of Siuila Run (Walk My Love) for us today. Listen to todays broadcast to hear it all.
item.itunes:keywords: Irish, Ireland, Traditional, Music, Song, History, Sean-Nos Theatre, America, Canada, Australia, England

item.title: Kerry Dancing, Pub Recitations, Beaufort
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary: From the Irish Roots Cafe Broadcast Network Contact Us at: www.Irishroots.com phone in your song or recitation to us at: 816-256-3360, speak or play clearly into the recorder. Be sure to listen to all 3 of our broadcast series. Todays Song: Kerry Dancing Peter Reilly Adams has just finished up with Danny Boy at the festival, and we discuss a bit about that. Peters Pub Singing experiences in England, Wales, Ireland and the U.S.. Notes on recitations and how we found them used, and how the reciter gets to choose the next one in line....The Michael Collins Movie.....people sharing their talents, songs, poems and stories. Sligo pub; Beaufort, County Kerry pub experience with a busload of Americans from Texas; Muckross Castle, the Donahue Castle; The Blarney from McCarthy. The Kingdom of Kerry. History of the Song: Kerry Dancers, or Days of the Kerry Dancing. Written by Malloy. You'll also hear this song in the Quiet Man with John Wayne and Maureen O'Hara. Peter performs the song in a solo performance live for us !
item.itunes:keywords: Irish, Ireland, Traditional, Music, Song, History, Sean-Nos Theatre, America, Canada, Australia, England

item.title: Danny Boy, The Blind O'Cahan Harper, History and Song
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary: From www.Irishroots.com and the Irish Roots Cafe With your hosts Mick the Bridge and Peter Reilly Adams. Today we talk about the origins and development of the tune that we know today as "Danny Boy", also known as The Aire of County Derry and the Londonderry Aire, to name but a few titles for this tune..... Peter Reilly Adams will sing the tune for us. This is the second in our series on early songs of the Irish in America. Phone in your favorite song, story or recitation to me ! Call 816-256-3360 and leave your entry on my recorder. You can even play your favorite tune. If it fits, we'll use the recording on a future show. *************************************************************
item.itunes:keywords: Irish, Ireland, Traditional, Music, Song, History, Sean-Nos Theatre, America, Canada, Australia, England

Todays Broadcast begins a series on early Irish Song History in America, and performance by Peter Reilly Adams of the 19th century song entitled "Dear Little Shamrock". This is the launch of our 3rd Broadcast Series. See also: Irish Families Worldwide Broadcast Series and The History of the Irish in America Series.

item.title: Irish Song, Story and Recitation Festival
item.itunes:author: Michael O'Laughlin
item.itunes:summary: Irish Song, Story and Recitation Festival New Broadcast Channel at www.Irishroots.com with your host, Mick the Bridge Announcing our new podcast series: From the Irish Roots Cafe and www.Irishroots.com Home of Songs, Sayings and Poetical Proverbs Consider sharing yours with us by calling (816) 256-3660, Just leave it on my recorder when you call. You can include some history and notes if you like. This is the 3rd channel from the Irish Roots Cafe, We hope you will enjoy our entire network: 1) Irish Families Worldwide 2) Irish in America 3) Irish Song and Recitation Our first shows will feature the champion from last years festival, Peter Reilly Adams, focusing on the early songs of the Irish in America, with influences from Minstrel shows, Theatre, and Tin Pan Alley in the 19th century. Peter will perform one song, with history and commentary each episode. Send in your stories and recitations now !
